text: the Third Way and this is maybe the best
uh was Dan Kaminsky and you know Dan has
since passed and I miss him a lot but uh
he used to have a tradition where he
would go to Defcon in Las Vegas and they
would just put him on the schedule he
didn't even have to uh file a proposal
they would just put them on there and it
would be something involving DNS and
then we'd all go there and see what it
was without knowing any more than that
and uh one year it was uh DS in where he
was using the the query uh Direction as
a way to transmit data and the response
Direction as a way to receive it and so
if you had a DNS tunnel endpoint on your
laptop which is how he demoed this uh
and it was talking to some DNS tunnel
Gateway somewhere that would turn your
DNS tunnel data back into normal packets
um then you could for example use a
hotel room uh Wi-Fi without paying for
it because they had to allow DNS to work
otherwise they couldn't make their pay
wall work and same thing for coffee
shops and everywhere else and so he just
used the fact that DNS was open by
default and his demo was Skype and he
held a full motion video conversation on
the big screen with somebody somewhere
using DNS tunneling and all of us were
just mind blown
[Music]
